intro: Peltactila parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered peltactila, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are palmately lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. Peltactila parviflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky outcrops.
